metadata.synopsis: Dark Urge Butler's dialogue after it's in camp.

9.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
9.text: That last run must have been the shortest time any Sceleritas lived! Can you beat the record?

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *Sceleritas seems unable to speak, ever since you commanded him not to.*

132.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
132.text: MMn- ahh. Oh, forgive my negligence! I entreat - don't do that to me again!

85.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
85.context: NodeContext: VERY PAINED AT THE INSULT

14.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
14.text: My fondest congratulations for your work in the Temple!

32.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
32.text: Well done! Well done indeed! On this eve, Sceleritas gazes upon perfection.

71.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
71.text: You shall be a graven God, my demiurge. All you must do now is heed your Father's advice when the time comes.

27.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
27.text: Not half as much as the world over will fear you.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: I shall bring a bloody storm upon this city, in Bhaal's name.

0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
0.text: In the carnage to come, you shall reach the peak of your holy magnificence.

34.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
34.text: It won't be long, Master... It won't be long.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I could not have become Bhaal's Chosen without you.

47.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
47.text: I shall engrave that compliment on my heart.

134.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
134.text: But you should rest, Master, you must be tired from all the sororicide!

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You turned into Bhaal! How did you survive?

36.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
36.text: Survive? I did not! it was my favourite death yet!

117.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
117.text: As he does each time I expire by your side, Bhaal has sent you another loyal Sceleritas, to watch over and adore you.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Begone! I don't need you any more!

6.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
6.text: M-Master... You speak the truth. You became his Chosen, and will go on to even greater deeds.

100.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
100.text: But if you don't need me, I shall perish. Once and for all.

7.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
7.text: I live to serve, as your Father made me. If I cannot serve...

115.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
115.text: Don't make me go, Master! Please!
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: Crying, pained, incredibly sadNodeContext: Sniffling, crying

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Perhaps you will be of use, still.

68.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
68.text: Oh, thank you, thank you! You shall not regret this, godly villain!

123.speaker: Player
123.text: A Bhaalspawn can have no friends.

57.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
57.text: A friend? You considered me 'a friend'?

90.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
90.text: If this is how it must be... Goodbye, Master.

28.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
28.text: Being in your service was an honour.

125.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler explodes using his butler spontaneous death animation he's had before. This time, once and for all.

20.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
20.text: Mmmmn. Oh. OH. That was euphoric. You're even better than you used to be.

135.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
135.text: Please kill me any time it takes your fancy: if I may be so bold.

23.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
23.text: Oh Master, I wish you could stand brutalising me forever.

26.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
26.text: How dare you? My life is my Master's alone to steal.

63.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
63.text: Master, you spoil me so. You have murdered me so sweetly time and time again.

78.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
78.text: But I worry you are distracted from your glory. There are others to kill besides me!

67.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
67.text: This is getting rather silly, my Liege. But I am enjoying myself.

69.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
69.text: Hee hee! Sceleritas is back again!

70.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
70.text: Your command is my wish. Your demand is my desire.

24.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
24.text: Inquisite me. What do you wish to know of?

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Bhaal told me I will rule, how do I achieve that?

107.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
107.text: Your tedious sister believed she was ending you when she drilled the wee tadpole-cavern in your head.

39.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
39.text: You were merely reborn... with a silver spoon in your brain.

131.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
131.text: The first to be tadpoled. The first above all men. I hope you are taking advantage of the worm: it will lead you to rule.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Will my Urges grow stronger, now Bhaal has such a hold over me?

108.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
108.text: You and the Urge are wedded, now. One body, one mind.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: When I bring ruin to the world, will Bhaal allow me to spare my beloved?

45.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
45.text: Of course, Master! We will always need to sire more Bhaalspawn!

44.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
44.text: It appears that may be already underway. The drow is a fecund choice of mate. Well done!

66.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
66.text: Hopefully the near-slaughter of your partner taught them the wisdom of obeying your every command.

82.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
82.text: Although if they are not up to the task we may need to find you a breeding-mate. Or ten.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Can I ever get my memories back?

10.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
10.text: My dear genderless champion... you are the hero of a sad tale.

80.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
80.text: You do not have a charm placed upon you to clear your memory-stores, nor an enchantment befuddling you.

105.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
105.text: Orin dug, Orin scooped, Orin dissected. Your brain is damaged forever.

114.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
114.text: But don't fret, I still think you're very clever. Despite your, ahem, little problem.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Can you tell me the worst thing I ever did?

84.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
84.text: There was one time you gave a beggar some coin while we were en route to the Devil's Fee.

61.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
61.text: You didn't kick him or spit on him or anything! I was so shocked I almost fainted!

130.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
130.text: I still have nightmares about it to this day. But I'm sure you only did so to lower the suspicions of the Flaming Fist. Surely?

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Did I live my whole life in the Temple of Bhaal?

97.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
97.text: Orin was born and raised in the Temple, but you spent many years on your own before you found your way back home.

109.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
109.text: Hence you have such diverse talents. But you were awful from the very first day you set foot amongst the ichored altars.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Who was my mother, if Bhaal was my Father?

52.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
52.text: Bhaal gave out all of his seed long ago, in the time of Sarevok.

94.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
94.text: You were not conceived. Bhaal sculpted you from a drop of his own gore.

56.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
56.text: No Bhaalspawn has ever borne the Urge, the holy guarantee of murder. It was woven into your blood alone.

43.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
43.text: Orin was not special. She was but a grandchild of an aged Bhaalspawn. A mere weed of Bhaal's loins.

54.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
54.text: Oh no! There are far more important matters at hand. But if you must waste time thinking of your Butler, I will attend to your curiosity.

89.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
89.text: I am but a table-scrap of Bhaal's will. He will send me to aid and protect you, until you have need of me no more.

87.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
87.text: As long as there have been Bhaalspawn, there have been Butlers, but Bhaal only makes them for the children he has use of.

98.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
98.text: Now, as you are the last true recipient of your Father's blessing, I suspect I am the last living Butler.

5.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
5.text: I was sent to guide you to your birthright, on the day my vile Liege reached their age of majority.

49.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
49.text: I hope we will stay together, always.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: How did you end up serving me, and not Orin?

22.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
22.text: Me? Serve Orin? I shall be sick! Fetch the Bucket of Bhaal!

53.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
53.text: Orin had her own Butler, who she insolently killed on his first visit, claiming she didn't need him to follow Bhaal.

4.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
4.text: Poor Cruor, never stood a chance.

29.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
29.text: The only way for a Butler to die is if we are not of use to our Master. But you have always needed abundant assistance.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Why are you at rest? Start cleaning the camp!

104.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
104.text: Aaah! Master! I'm sorry, I'm ever-so sorry to forget my other duties! What a wretch I am! I'm not even worthy of being your scullery maid.
104.context: NodeContext: Startled, realises he has done poorly

95.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
95.text: At once. I will shatter some glasses and sprinkle the fragments in the beds of your other followers. Keep their dreams bloody.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: I jest, cleaning is beneath my chief manservant.

17.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
17.text: I shall attend to your miserable royal person with great care. You shall be well-groomed with my tincy talons. Yes, yes.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Cease your chattering! A Butler of mine will not speak unless spoken to!

60.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
60.text: Wait, Master, if you ask me to- Mmmpfh!
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halfway through the sentence the butler's mouth snaps shut.NodeContext: Panicked

77.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mouth shut, trying to talkNodeContext: Making noises through a closed mouth - cannot talk

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I want to thank you for all your help.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I have no further use for you, begone!

75.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
75.text: Hello, you must be one of Master's other servants.

33.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
33.text: Why they chose to take one such as yourself as a retainer is beyond me.

106.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
106.text: Know that I love them best.

35.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
35.text: Your presence will be tolerated in their company, if you do not interfere with their holy destiny.

1.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
1.text: The beady eye of tiny Sceleritas is upon you, do not forget that.

86.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
86.context: NodeContext: ANGRILY but can't express it because silenced

92.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
92.text: Oh, my pustulating godhead! Why do you degrade yourself, wearing the shameful hatpiece of a mere servant?

116.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
116.text: It is an honour to see you look so fetching, but let me dress you properly on the morrow.

110.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
110.text: Away! Attend to your duties! Lazy little maid you are!

118.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
118.text: I love you when you hurt me, Master.

119.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
119.context: NodeContext: Happily and satisfied after being killed
